item.title: Boogie & Woogie
item.description: Boogie is big and round! Woogie likes to get up in their business. They're both so silly and hungry! They visit a lot and stare at me when I'm naked. Or maybe they're just looking at their reflections. Woogie makes chatter sounds a lot.

item.title: Nut Tricks
item.description:
Just some cute crow vids recently! Crows do all sorts of neat stuff with their beaks and nuts.

Catgirl has named the balcony friends Boogie and Woogie. They're very silly together.

I just can't get over how cute Groof is

item.title: Silly Crow Loses an Egg
item.description: Maybe they were waiting for their friend to take it? I love how they walk off at the end, as if they weren't keeping the egg for later. Or maybe they weren't, and they wanted to share it. But the way the other crow snatches it away seems like they thought they were being sneaky.

item.title: Groof Time
item.description:
Pretty Groof

Groof and Groofriend bungling an egg

Groof tripping on a brick ahhhhhh

item.title: Very Silly Crows
item.description:
The Great Egg Bamboozle

This is one of my new favorites. I just turned around and Groof's egg was gone! And then I turned around again and suddenly Groof is right there. They're so swift and quiet.

Groof also has a very cute tube trot

Longlegs Gets Bapped

Longlegs likes putting eggs in puddles for some reason. I think they're just used to putting food in water to make it easier to eat. Their friend Fussy disagrees and baps them in the head! I looks like a friendly bap at least.

I also tried putting treats on a bike seat to see what would happen, but Fussy couldn't hold on very well. I didn't get a video, but Longlegs also was sliding down some parking gizmo due to the rain.

item.title: Lost Stash in Leaves
item.description: This was outside Rubenstein's while I was eating a bagel. I had stashed a bunch of treats for 3 nearby crows who were all very excited and very very hungry. They restashed a bunch of the treats, and this one either couldn't remember where they stashed them, or was just hoping to get lucky maybe.

item.title: Messy Fussy
item.description: Fussy is Longleg's friend. Longlegs is more of a stasher, Fussy likes to make big messes and only eats their favorite treats

item.title: Balcony Visitor
item.description: I heard a plink and saw them grabbing peanuts, and dropping a few too. I had seen them earlier outside my building, but didn't have many treats with me because Long Legs and Fussy and Groof were very hungry crows. I hope they come again üò∏

item.title: The Groof Toll
item.description: Groof's mouth is already full of treats! I had walked up a little to leave treats on the ramp, but both Groof and Groofriend landed so that I would have to pass them on the way back down. Groof does some good flappy hops.

item.title: Purple Groof
item.description: I'm not sure what causes them to look like this, I think the angle of the sun? Maybe I should look up the time of day I took it and try again. It adds to my suspicion that crows see UV light and is maybe part of how they tell each other apart.

item.title: Crow Butt
item.description: Such pretty tail feathers too

item.title: Egg
item.description: I think they can't hold it down due to their foot? I smooshed the egg up for them a little, and then they were able to fly off with it. They had already stashed a bunch of peanuts too. Longlegs is happy to receive a lot of treats it seems.

item.title: Egg Teacher
item.description:
I think this might be Groof's honker? Really hard to say. I thought they were Groof at first because they recognized me, but they're super scared of the egg and tube and Groof just went at the tube yesterday.

After they peck the egg, they walk off to the side and give me a sad crow look pretty similar to what Groof does üòø

A different crow, maybe Groof? comes and helps them with chatters of encouragement.

Part of why I think they're a juvenile is how excited their lil' trots are. Egg Drop is one of my favorite special crow moves. I need to make a list of them all.

item.title: Power Pecks
item.description:
I just sit down on a bench, and Groof shows up!

This is the first time I've seen Groof pierce the tube. I like seeing them use their feet manipulate stuff. They got a ton of treats today.

Maybe they get peck practice in when they take the tubes to the Groof roof.

item.title: Groofy morning
item.description:
Some dork passed by which was funny

Groof pecking at the tube. Do they just like pecking? It does look satisfying. Good pecks.

Groof leaves with egg while Groofriend distracts me. Looking back at the video, it was kind of obvious that Groof was about to knock the egg off.

item.title: Squirrel Attack!
item.description:
I was at the kitty loft waiting for her to come home from surg and went out to visit her crow friends. They ate all the peanuts I had!

I saw the squirrel to the side and was thinking they were dangerous but they still got me off guard. Sometimes I see them on reddit getting along with crows, but now I know they're a hazard.

Afterwards I went back to the kitty loft and got more treats for them.

item.title: It's Green Bandit
item.description:
This is Green Bandit, who I assume is research crow from UW. They seem pretty friendly. I've seen crows with the green bands maybe a dozen times now, but not sure if they're all the same crow.

Green Bandit can carry two peanuts, but not three, so they call their friend for help. They can caw with their beak full of peanuts apparently! But honkers need to use their whole body to honk. Also it seems like pigeons have started sensing that I have food, but they probably can't open peanuts or eggs.

Their friend heisted the egg away. Maybe they've had a gobbo egg before?

item.title: Swooped by Longlegs
item.description:
I didn't they were Longlegs until Catgirl pointed out their injured foot. It felt like it had been a while since I had seen them, but I think I just wasn't identifying them.

They're so friendly! So exciting when they get close. I reacted too slowly to catch the swoop by my head on video.

item.title: The Merp-Dump
item.description: Merp likes to shake all the treats out of bags. It's one of the ways I identify them! They are looking very pretty today. Berp was also around to pick up stray treats.

item.title: The Three Peanut Problem
item.description: They couldn't do it üò¢

item.title: Grabby Groof
item.description:
Groof and Groofriend vying for treats

Groof is the slightly larger one with a rounder beak, and the instigator.

Groof wants more

I love the cute groof look.

item.title: Groof Greeting
item.description: Groof took another tube to the Groof roof after.

item.title: Hop hop hop
item.description: I think the hoppy one is Longlegs, and the other is Fussy? The peanut crow was never able to pick up 3 peanuts at once.
